text: Lightning strikes, illuminating a vine covered wall as th camera moves across a dark alley filled with CARDBOARD BO and CRATES. They boxes have stylized LABELS; the box in front is labeled FOCUS FEATURES.
SFX: FOOTSTEPS running on cobblestones and LABORED BREATH
No. Not my boy!
Lightning strikes again, highlighting the boxes and rubbi in the alley. Something is coming. Whatever it is, its breath is hurried and animalistic.
SFX: A BABY CRIES out.

Stumpy CLAWED FEET wrapped in rag run past a boxed labele LAIKA. The camera follows the shadowed figure as it runs along cobblestones to the end of the lane. The creature pauses under an arched entryway and turns, revealing GLOW EYES, a large mouth full of wonky teeth, and a BABY SHAPE BUNDLE in its arms.
LIGHTING CRASHES as the BABY wriggles and cries.
CLOSE ON: A FIST pounds a door.
Wake his lordship.
SFX: A SERIES OF LOCKS being unlatched on the door.
A BUTLER opens the double doors, frowns. He starts to clo the doors but Snatcher pushes against the effort.
The unspeakable has happened. (GASP) We must speak of it immediately!
A voice calls out from behind them.
What is it, Snatcher?
The butler moves aside, revealing a regal man with a whit hat at the top of an ornate marble staircase.
LORD PORTLEY-RIND looks on from the mezzanine. The man in the red hat casts a long shadow across the gleaming check floors of the Cheese Guild.
Boxtroll monsters have stolen a child.
CLOSE ON: Lord Portley-Rind, perfectly groomed and perfec horrified.
No.

CLOSE ON: ARCHIBALD SNATCHER in the door, backlit by streetlights, sheets of rain falling behind him. He's a b man, but out of shape (all belly and no butt), with long shreds of greasy hair sprouting from beneath his crooked
They're no doubt picking their teeth with his adorable baby bones by now!
A horrible tragedy. (beat, flippant) Let's deal with it in the morning!
Portley-Rind turns to go.
STOP!
The Butler closes the door, but Snatcher shoves his foot the way.
Oh, oof! That's not the worst of it! Next they'll come after...
The Butler shoves at the door, slapping and shoving Snatcher's face until the door slams shut. Snatcher opens mail slot and yells through it.
...OUR CHEESES!
My Gouda!?
They'll stop at nothing.
Portley-Rind suddenly flings open the doors, stares wide at Snatcher. He is crouched on the ground near the mail slot.
You're the town exterminator. I'll pay whatever it takes.
Snatcher stands slowly.
Oh, I don't want money.
He steps into the house and into the light, REVEALING his greedy face for the first time. He smiles an oily smile.
I want one of those.
Snatcher points to the WHITE HAT on Portley-Rind's head. Portley-Rind grabs his hat protectively.
A White Hat? You?! Absurd!
Snatcher turns to leave, moving towards the damp Market Square.
Alright then. But prepare to say bye bye to your Brie. Cheerio to your Cheddar. Goodbye to your...
Portley-Rind's resolve disappears. He raises his hand as to stop Snatcher from leaving.
Very well. Every boxtroll gone. With proof!
Snatcher stops halfway down the stairs in the pouring rai his back still turned to Portley-Rind.
For a white hat?
CLOSE ON: Snatcher's grinning face as he turns back towar Portley-Rind.
I will destroy every last boxtroll in this town!
LIGHTNING CRASHES as Snatcher laughs maniacally.

WIDE VIEW OF CHEESEBRIDGE, a steep hill-town that looms o the countryside. A jumble of roofs, a tangle of twisting alleys, and perched at the summit, the imposing Cheese Gu Hall. The last rays of the setting sun disappear.
--a deep voice echoes out of a scratchy MEGAPHONE.
Hear ye! Hear ye! Good citizens of Cheesebridge, the curfew is in force. Don't dawdle or the beasts will tear you limb from limb!
CLOSE ON: A FABRIC BANNER reading "BOXTROLL EXTERMINATORS

The banner hangs on a strange rattletrap TRUCK that winds way up the city streets. Sinister looking men in BLOOD RE TOP HATS hang onto the running boards. The most sinister them all, Snatcher, rides on the roof.
They will add your flesh to their rivers of blood and mountains of bones.

As the truck passes, PEDESTRIANS gasp and hurry into thei houses, heeding the amplified warning. A CHEESEMONGER at Cheesery pulls his FOLDING SIGN from the sidewalk and hur inside. A COUPLE stops mid-conversation and heads indoors MAN CARRYING A CRATE brings his load into his shop, abandoning the crate sitting at the curb. Two FEMALE TOWNSFOLK head off down the street.
CLOSE ON: Archibald Snatcher as the truck rounds a corner He holds a MEGAPHONE TUBE to his mouth and orates as he z in on a BOY playing ball in the street.
Child! Do you want to end up like the Trubshaw Baby?
The boy watches the truck as it passes, curiosity changin horror.
Dragged underground and feasted upon one year ago this very night?!
The terrified boy shakes his head and GASPS as he is yank inside by his MOTHER. His BALL bounces out of his hands a rolls across the cobbles.
Lock your windows! Bolt your doors! Hide anything that is not bolted down.
One man grabs his DOOR KNOCKER and bolts inside.
Another man grabs his MAILBOX.
Another a BARBER POLE.
With a terrified look the last man peers out of the peep in his door, then slams it shut.
Hide your cheese. Hide your tender and delicious babies!
The wind blows trash down the empty streets. Snatcher's vehicle, rattling from its boiler, prowls past with Snatc still calling out his warning until the sound fades in th distance.
Beware the bloodthirsty monsters! They'll fry your eyes, gnaw on your knees, gobble your gizzards... Beware! BEWARE!
After Snatcher's truck has passed the CAMERA lands on: A MANHOLE. Carved in the heavy iron cover is a warning: "HE BE MONSTERS".

A LONG BEAT OF SILENCE. The manhole cover slowly twists a lifts, a pudgy blue hand emerges. Two pairs of yellow, glowing eyes peer out. The creatures talk in expressive b unintelligible GURGLES. Down the street, two more manhole covers lift.

In pairs and in gangs, these BOXTROLLS -- so called for t cardboard boxes they wear -- emerge from the sewers and scurry through the streets of the besieged town. Their lo forboding SHADOWS creep across walls plastered with poste that read: "CHEESEBRIDGE: A GOUDA PLACE TO LIVE", "REDHAT BOXTROLL EXTERMINATORS".

We watch them scurry through streets and alleyways, gurgl quiet directions to each other. They move swiftly and tra in packs. We see a lone boxtroll jump and pull himself in his box as a DOG BARKS. He pops back out of his box and m along quickly.

CLOSE ON: what appears to be a LARGE BOXTROLL MONSTER pee around the corner of a moonlight street. Its glowing eyes turn toward the camera as it sways slowly. Five more pair eyes light up within the large, boxy shadow and SIX BOXTR separate from the mass, popping off to run their errands while the coast is clear.
BIRDS EYE VIEW: Groups of two and three boxtrolls snake t way down streets, skirting carefully around areas lit by street lamps.
In a small lane, groups of boxtrolls stop to collect mechanical stuff. They work together, using their boxes a tools and props.
SIX BOXTROLLS stack up in the background to steal a SHOP SIGN, while THREE BOXTROLLS cooperatively steal the WHEEL from a WOODEN CART.

One boxtroll uses his box to prop up a       corner while two release the wheel from the axle. A       LONE BOXTROL the frame to see what treasures he may       find in a tr as he knocks it over with a CLANG, TWO       BOXTROLLS sc and stack together, stealing the HOUSE       NUMBER from of a brownstone.
CLOSE ON: the boxtrolls' booty - the shiny brass number ` the shop sign for `TIMELESS TIMEPIECES', the wheel that r along between two boxtrolls.
Six other boxtrolls on the hunt stack together against a fence. We watch as one boxtroll makes it over the top, cooperatively pulling the others into the alley behind hi

CLOSE ON: The inside of a trash can as the lid is removed Two BOXTROLL HANDS wriggle into view over the rubbish, fi of NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS, an APPLE CORE, a BANANA PEEL, and FISH CARCASS. The boxtroll gurgles "EWW" and "BLECH" soun as he moves these unwanted items aside. He gurgles with j when a bit of brass is revealed.

FISH, a nervous 4-foot tall, wonky-toothed, pointy-eared, gangly-limbed boxtroll, pulls an old broken ALARM CLOCK f the trash barrel. He is in a large alley, filled with old boxes, crates, broken items and tarps strewn about.
Fish stares curiously at the object, turning it over in h hands and holding it to his ear, listening. He shakes the clock and hears loose gears RATTLE.
Hmm...

Fish opens the clock face        and gurgles, intently to the mechanical interior.         After a moment, the cloc TICK with activity. Fish         gurgles excitedly and cl clock face, holding it to        his ear to listen to the ticking.
(GURGLES) Oh yeah...
Fish's eyes go wide as the clock's alarm RINGS, attractin the attention of an uglier, 2-foot-2 boxtroll.
Huh?
As Fish stands proudly admiring the sound of his ringing alarm clock, SHOE bounces around his feet.
(GURGLES) Gimme that!

Shoe, short and feisty, grabs the alarm clock from Fish a scampers away with it. Fish watches as Shoe climbs a stac crates and hisses back at him, sniffing at his new prize. Fish scowls at Shoe and returns to the rubbish pile, shak his head and muttering.

Behind him a half-dozen boxtrolls methodically pick throu an assortment of trash barrels and old boxes. It's like a troop of monkeys at the dump. They find mechanical stuff, inspect it, and then either drop it into their box to kee toss it back into the trash.
A filthy TEDDY BEAR WITH A MUSICAL KEY is discarded by another boxtroll, landing with a THUNK and A FEW TINNY MUSICAL NOTES. Fish turns excitedly.
Ohhhh...
He picks up the teddy bear and cranks a key in its back a Shoe toys with the stolen alarm clock. The teddy bear pla MUSIC. Fish gurgles along to the tune and bobs his head, enjoying the moment.

Again, Shoe notices Fish has found something interesting. shoves the alarm clock into his box, stealthily sneaks up Fish and makes a grab for the teddy bear! Fish refuses to go and they squabble over it. Suddenly all the boxtrolls to attention, their ears alert--
The creepy RATTLING SOUNDS of the Redhats' truck returns.
All the boxtrolls hide in their boxes. The "camouflage" works. Their boxes fit in perfectly with the trash barrel and packing crates.
The rattling comes closer... closer... then STOPS.
BAM! HEADLIGHTS light up the alley.
Three men dismount from the truck and cast long shadows across the alley and all of the boxes: the giant MR. TROU the beanpole thin MR. PICKLES, and the short, pit bull MR GRISTLE.
The boxtrolls don't run -- they just KEEP HIDING IN THEIR BOXES.
GENTLEMEN!
Snatcher spreads his arms theatrically and wades into the garbage-strewn alley.
Look at all these boxes left lying about. How curious, how peculiar. I do believe... evil is afoot.
Gristle chuckles and breaks into a psychotic grin.
HAHAHA. FOOT.
Huh.
Fish peeks out of his box momentarily, then retreats when sees the Redhats advancing into the alley.

Mr. Trout and Mr. Pickles absentmindedly check boxes for boxtrolls, but Mr. Gristle methodically stomps and smashe every box he can. When he finds a box with a boxtroll, he uses a CRICKET BAT to WHACK it back to the others to load onto the truck.
You ever seen someone's foot be evil, Mr. Trout?
I believe the boss meant evil is nearby, Mr. Pickles.
My foot had a pretty nasty bunion once. I wouldn't say the foot itself was evil.
No, it's just a fancy-man's word for vicinity.
Wrinkly ol' bunion looked like my grandmum. Had to saw her off. The bunion, not my grandmum.
Mr. Gristle spots a shivering box and positions himself o it, cricket bat in hand.
Ah, yes.   FOOT!
WHACK! Gristle kicks the box, and it flies toward Mr. Pic and Mr. Trout.
There's one!
Mr. Pickles scoops it up in a dog catcher's net.
Come on, ya squirmy monster. Your days of evil-doin' are over.
Mr. Gristle finds another shivering box. He swings his ba
BOOM!
WHACK! A box slides over to Trout. A dizzy boxtroll pops for a moment, groaning. Trout taps its head and the boxtr retreats.
You really think these boxtrolls understand the duality of good and evil?
They must, right? Why else would they hide from us. We are the good guys.
Mr. Pickles strolls off with both boxtroll and net.
(hitting more boxes) Nice! NICE!
WHACK! Another box slides over to Trout. Trout scoops up box before the creature can get away. The boxtroll's legs dangle below as it is carried away.
Yeah... I suppose we are.
CLOSE ON: Fish and Shoe, in the shadows at the edge of th alley, gurgle to each other while the Red Hats are distracted. Their heads stay hidden in their boxes as the waddle slowly out of the alley.
Mr. Gristle is too preoccupied with smashing other boxes notice them. He grunts and laughs with the effort.
Snatcher spots Fish and Shoe as they exit the alley and points at them.
MR. GRISTLE!
Hmm?
ACQUIRE THEM!
Brandishing his cricket bat, Gristle springs after Fish a Shoe.
Acquire! ACQUIRE! HAHAHA!
The boxtrolls pop out of their boxes and RUN!
Gristle closes in on them as they sprint down an alley. T boxtrolls join hands and vault over a fence like a Slinky toy.
Gristle smashes THROUGH the fence--
COME BACK AND LET ME HIT YOU!
--but the boxtrolls have disappeared. Gristle stalks down street and disappears around a corner.
After Gristle disappears, two boxes that are holding up a broken street cart suddenly move. It's Fish and Shoe hidi in plain sight.
Once they are sure they are not being followed they open drainage pipe and slip underground into the sewers--
(0300 UDW) UNDERWORLD Eggs
-- where they leap into cardboard-lined BOXTROLL CHUTES. drop through the chutes, sliding on the cardboard, until join up with other boxtrolls returning from a night of gathering.
They descend deeper underground until they are collected together in a funnel-shaped cave and one by one drop onto

-- elaborate conveyor belt system for a roller coaster ri into a HUGE DARK SPACE with blinking lights and a cacopho of MECHANICAL NOISE. Fish, Shoe and boxtrolls of all shap and sizes shoot off the end of the conveyor belt and tumb across the floor.

ON FISH AND SHOE where the alarm clock lands on the floor they tumble to a halt. Shoe grabs the clock possessively, hisses at Fish, and runs away laughing. He has his treasu Fish shrugs it off and rights himself, raising a hand to mouth.
"Eggs?"

REVEAL THE CAVERN, the hub of the boxtroll world. It's fu of workshops, interconnected machines and a constellation lights that make it look like a subterranean Coney Island amusement park. Fish stands in front of a large STALAGMIT around which the mechanical underground city is built.
"Eggs?"
WHEELS - a boxtroll riding a unicycle - zooms quickly pas humming.
"You see Eggs?"

Wheels shrugs his shoulders and rides away as OIL CAN - t smallest boxtroll - tumbles from the conveyor belt and ri himself with a squeak. Oil Can pulls, well, an OIL CAN fr inside of his box and scurries off.
Fish makes his way to the base of a waterwheel made from scraps of metal.

High overhead, the boxtroll KNICKERS - a picture of underpants adorning the front of it's box - struggles wit armful of light bulbs while swinging from a rope. Two sma boxtrolls hold the rope steady below.
SPARKY, a boxtroll wearing welding goggles, and a small boxtroll named BUCKET work side by side on an electrical generator, fitting dinner forks into a toaster as makeshi fuses.
"Eggs?"
Sparky and Bucket look up from their work and give Fish directions to find Eggs.
(gurgled in unison) "Over there!"
In the background, Oil Can climbs down a pipe to grease u the generator and then scrambles back up the pipe.

Fish heads off as Sparky and Bucket turn on the toaster a get ZAPPED! They jerk and squirm as electricity courses through their boxes and they collapse on the ground. The strands of light bulbs flicker and light up.
Sparky and Bucket smile and beat their boxes in delight - they fixed the generator. The two boxtrolls holding the r let go and beat their boxes. Knickers falls to the ground
AHHH!!!!

Fish arrives at a SUBTERRANEAN GARDEN where boxtrolls sit among huge cabbages eating ladybugs and slugs. Fish stops front of FRAGILE, a giant, slow moving, dim-witted boxtro Fragile slowly mists a seedling plant.
"Eggs?"
Fragile just stares at Fish until Fish gets frustrated an leaves. Fragile slowly points, in the direction opposite Fish's path.
Eggs.
ON A BOXTROLL'S REAR END. He scratches the backside of hi box and - WHOOSH! - is sucked up into the air, revealing Fish.
Fish steps up to a huge PNEUMATIC TUBE driven by a dozen antique vacuum cleaners and calls up to SWEETS, a toothle boxtroll with a set of old human dentures in his mouth.
"Eggs?!"

Sweets stops, thinks, gets an idea and starts to speak ju as SPECS, a myopic boxtroll with an elaborate head gear o eye glasses, twists an ANCHOR switch, turning on the pneumatic tubes. First his DENTURES, then Sweets, are suc up into the tube. Fish watches Sweets go and then sees Oi Can standing on top of the tubes oiling stuff.
"EGGS?"
Oil Can stops oiling the tubes.
"He's up there!"
Oil Can points up at a small cave high on the cavern wall
Fish arrives at the opening of the small dark cave. In th shadows of the nook is a shape. It appears to be a very s boxtroll.
Eggs?
(low, feral growls)

Out of the shadows waddles the small boxtroll. The first thing that comes into the light is his box with an EGGS L printed on the front, then appears the dirty face of a fe looking 2-YEAR-OLD HUMAN BOY, EGGS.
Fish flashes a wonky-toothed smile at Eggs.
Fish!

Fish plays a game of hide and seek with the found teddy b He makes the arm, then another arm, then the head appear the arm and head holes of his box. Baby Eggs is enthralle He excitedly launches himself at Fish. They play wrestle the toy until Eggs grabs it from Fish and scampers away.
Eggs hugs the bear. So cute. Then... RIPS ITS HEAD OFF!
He reaches into the teddy bear's chest cavity and pulls o the MUSIC BOX. He tosses the gutted bear body away and tr to get it to work. When he can't figure it out he holds i up to Fish.
Fish?
Fish winds the music box, gurgling an explanation of how works. Music fills the dark nook.
Eggs giggles with delight as the gears work again.    The close their eyes and hum along to the music.
Do do doo do doo...
(hums along with music)
They stop humming when the giant clock chimes signaling t end of the boxtroll "day".
CLOSE ON: the clock as the large hands representing the m and the sun flip.
As the lights go out, Knickers and the other boxtrolls ga at the center of the cavern to sleep in a big, communal s of boxes like one big family.
The sleeping pile is stacked tight and high. Fish and Egg climb to the top of the pile. Fish holds Eggs up so he ca pull a chain to turn out the last light in the cavern.

Baby Eggs lies   looking straight up. The ceiling of the is dotted with   lots of small lights and slowly turning machines -- it   looks like the flickering of stars. Baby happily drifts   off to sleep, snuggling the head he ripp from the teddy   bear.
The boxtroll clock chimes, signaling it is night above gr and time to wake up! Eggs swings from the light bulb and
Wake up!
The box pile explodes and falls apart as all the boxtroll are startled awake.
- EGGS NOOK: Fish winds up the teddy bear's MUSIC BOX and adds it to a MUSIC MACHINE, built out of assorted junk an driven by the teddy bear's music box.
Eggs pounds a hammer on a typewriter at the bottom of the machine and Fish pulls out a saw and draws a bow across i Together they play a croaking music-mechanique song.
- Eggs rides on WHEELS' shoulders. Wheels makes gurgling sounds like he is revving his engines. They ride around t base of the CONVEYOR BELT, watching boxtrolls roll down f the CHUTES.
Wheels swerves to avoid boxtrolls as they tumble off of t conveyor belt, holding Eggs out to Fish as he rolls into view. Fish catches Eggs and runs with him held like a football.
- Fish in the cavern nook. He pulls out a prize bit of ju a 78 rpm album by the QUATTRO SABATINO. Eggs' eyes go wid
OOOH! Hee hee hee.

Fish puts the record on the player and lowers the needle. Baby Eggs holds on to the record player, shaking his bott to the beat and dancing, while Fish plays a MUSICAL SAW w his BOW. Eggs dances and turns to Fish, beating his box approvingly.
- CLOSE ON: A roiling pile of BUGS as boxtroll hands, and baby human's hand, reach in and grab fists full of bugs.
Boxtrolls munch up mouthfuls of bugs and Eggs chomps away with them, just another monster.
- Eggs and Fish play music in the nook, their music machi is evolving. First Eggs shakes the jar of buttons, then h strikes a beat on a cowbell.
- Eggs is chasing Oil Can. He trips on his box and falls on his face, popping out of his box by mistake. Oil Can s Eggs empty box and FREAKS!
AAAAHHH!

Oil Can's wailing gets all the boxtrolls in the cavern to turn, see the empty box and SCREAM! It's a collective communal melt down - Fish runs up to Eggs in a panic, cra his box back on and GURGLES the rule-
BOXTROLLS NEVER TAKE OFF THEIR BOXES!
- Baby Eggs and Fish continue to play their music in the nook. Eggs hit the cowbell expertly with a spoon and danc smiling and laughing.

- 11 YEAR OLD EGGS laughing absolutely rocking out to the music machine with the Quattro Sabatino song mixed in. Eg plays the WASHBOARD while Fish plays his saw. The jar of buttons and the cowbell have been added to the music mach
- Close on several PILL BUGS crawling on the cavern floor Shoe pokes them and they curl into a ball. He gathers the up and growls happily from behind a pile of junk, eyeing Eggs.
Eggs hides behind a little barrier of corrugated metal wi his own pile of pill bug balls. Shoe hurls a bug at Eggs misses, hitting the metal.
Ha! Missed me!
Eggs tosses a bug at Shoe, and Shoe smugly laughs as the flies into a tube. While he laughs, the bug shoots out fr the tube, smacking him on his nose. OOF!
- Eggs and Fish are grooving along to their music machine Eggs transitions from the washboard to smashing light bul with a SKILLET.
Outside of the nook, other boxtrolls bob their heads happ along with the music.
- CLOSE ON: Eggs as he slides on a "new" HELMET made out junk. It is fitted with lights so he can see in the dark.

PULL OUT. Eggs stands beneath the pneumatic tubes as the boxtrolls gather around him. Specs throws the switch and Eggs is sucked up the tubes, the boxtrolls beat their box in excitement. Shoe unceremoniously steps into the tube w the others celebrate.
- The shadowy shapes of Fish, then Shoe, then a super exc Eggs spring out of a manhole and scamper into the night.
Soon after, Shoe finds an umbrella, Fish holds up a buste wheel.
Ahh!
Oooo!
Eggs finds his first real "treasure" in an alleyway - a broken EGG BEATER.
Oooh!

- Wheels zooms towards us carrying a MAIL BOX. Eggs pushe Shoe in a wheelbarrow as Fish runs along, all cheering wi their loot. Suddenly BLAM! Wheels is hit by a BOLAS! Eggs leaps into a barrel and the others hide as the Redhats cl down from their truck and carry Wheels away.
HA HAAA!
Another villain off the streets!
Eggs starts to move, to go after Wheels.   Fish holds him back.
(protesting, quietly) Wheels!
(as Fish holds his arm) What?!
(shaking his head) Hide.
Eggs stares after his friend and slowly slips down to hid a barrel.
- Like monsters from a child's nightmare the Redhats loom of the darkness, smash boxes and collect boxtrolls.
- The boxtroll sleeping pile dwindles as more and more boxtrolls are kidnapped.
- Another night of scavenging as a garden gate hinge SQUE Eggs and Fish continue running but Oil Can can't help him - he stops to oil the gate.
Oil Can doesn't realize Gristle is standing right behind aiming a medieval looking BLUNDERBUSS BOLAS GUN!
BLAM! He fires point blank, capturing Oil Can. The little boxtroll's oil can flies down the street and lands in fro of Eggs' hiding spot. Eggs WHIMPERS.

- SLEEPING PILE: The significantly smaller community tuck for the night as the now rusty water wheel squeaks in the background. Eggs looks forlorn and holds Oil Can's oil ca Fish GURGLES reassuringly to him.
As Fish slips into his box to sleep, Eggs SIGHS and looks at the greatly reduced number of "stars" (light bulbs) in ceiling. The water wheel squeaks constantly in the background.
Eggs scampers through thick fog across a large Market Squ encircled by regal buildings. At the far end stands the impressive CHEESE GUILD.
Fish and Shoe lag behind.
This way.
Shoe runs face first into a STREET LAMP - BOOM! - sending gears and baubles clattering to the cobbles.
Shoe! Come on.

Eggs and the boxtrolls' silhouettes skitter across the square, over to a small side alley. There is a LOUD CLANG Eggs and the boxtrolls run into a trash barrel, sending t trash can lid noisily rolling across the square.
PAN UP the Cheese Guild... a LIGHT COMES ON IN A WINDOW.
IN THE WINDOW, peeking from behind an ornate curtain, a y girl watches the trash can lid fall over and wobble to a stop.
The young girl, WINNIE (12, red-hair, nightgown) GASPS wi fear -- and fascination -- then whips the curtains closed
Boxtrolls! (SHUDDER) They could come eat my face off at any moment.
I'd better warn father.
Winnie runs down a staircase towards a set of double door The SOUND of LAUGHTER and WAFFLING VOICES grows as Winnie approaches the door.
Winnie knocks gently. No response. She knocks harder. Sti no response. She impetuously pushes the door open.
It's a Victorian MAN CAVE. A dark, ornate rotunda with wa lined with cases of RARE CHEESES. At a table stacked with FINE CHEESES, four men are seated, wearing gleaming WHITE HATS.

BOULANGER, an old man in a STEAM-POWERED WHEEL CHAIR, sno at one end of the table while the short, rotund LANGSDALE tall, thin, beak-nosed BRODERICK roar with laughter at th other end. Standing imperiously in the middle, and wearin the most ornate white hat, is LORD PORTLEY-RIND.
Settle down, men, settle down. Important town business to discuss. First on the docket: more complaints of crumbling bridges.
Speaking of crumbling... is that a new blue cheese I see?
Broderick stands and leans into the cheese, breathing dee
Does smell delicious.
I suppose we could do with a nibble first.
They taste cheeses like snobs tasting fine wines -- sniff rolling it on their tongues, spitting in buckets, etc.
Mmm... Pungent...
Complex...
I'm tasting notes of... plum!
Boulanger snores.
(mouth full, reading
All good fun, but we do have this school funding initiative to vote on. Been sitting here for months. All in favor of--
--Cutting open the Roquefort next?
AYE!!
Lord Portley-Rind tosses the docket behind him, giving in
Well, okay, okay. A quick reminder, tomorrow is Trubshaw Baby Remembrance Day.
And we all know what that means... a performance by Madame Frou Frou.
A burst of STEAM shoots out of Boulanger's wheelchair.
A VISION!
Now there's a woman...
... With some cheese on her bones!
Portley-Rind leans in like he has a secret, and slowly caresses a piece of brie as he says:
A lady like that is like a fine brie. Raw. Dangerous.
Maybe a little stinky, but one taste and you'll be begging for... mmm . . .
Lord Portley-Rind nuzzles the brie and kisses its crust.
Father!
Suddenly, he looks up he sees:
WINIFRED!
He SQUEEZES the cheese in his hand, which EXPLODES all ov A hunk of the brie lands on his hat. He jumps up and stor over to the door. The White hats murmur and gasp.
Winifred go on. Off to bed. Off to bed! Come on, come on.
But Father! I saw boxtrolls again!
Shoo. Shoo. Shoo.
Portley-Rind's eyes keep sliding back toward the room beh him, where the others are tasting another fine cheese.
They're right outside. They could come rip the flesh off my bones any moment!
Behind them: LOUD grunts of satisfied tasting.
Would be a shame to miss this, Portley-Rind!
Yes, yes one moment! (to Winnie, distracted) Winifred, proper girls should not be obsessing over grotesque monsters.
Portley-Rind's attention is directed to the shenanigans g on behind him.
I'm not obsessed! I just can't stop imagining them gnawing off my toes and stringing them together as a necklace! Father? Father.
Mmm hmm. Yes.
Portley-Rind turns back and pats Winnie on the head like is a little dog.
If they kidnapped me and slurped up my intestines like noodles, would you give up your white hat to save me?
(still not listening) Hmm? Um. Yes, Winifred.
Father!
What? Uh... White Hat? Right. (looks at his hat) What.. Oh, seems to have been smudged by a bit of brie. Be a dear and have the butler give it a wash, would you?
He hands a stunned Winnie his White Hat and turns her tow the stairs.
He closes the door on her before she can finish her thoug
Now gentlemen, I apologize... sorry! Back to important White Hat business... Pass the Camembert!
Winnie is hurt and frustrated. She looks down at the Whit Hat in her hands. Her eyes narrow.
I'll give your hat a wash all right.
High on the front of the Guild, Winnie bursts through a s of french doors and onto a balcony holding the white hat, face an angry scowl.
She tosses Lord Portley-Rind's hat, frisbee style, out in the night sky. The hat glows in the moonlight as it sails across the Market Square.
The white hat hits the ground in the middle of the square
She smiles, satisfied, dusts her hands.
Ha!
Then, her smile slowly melts as she realizes this was not brightest move. She hears raucous laughter from the Tasti Room.
Uh oh.
CLOSE ON DOOR as Winnie quickly unbolts the locks and cra the door.
Winnie cautiously peeks out of the Guild. The light behin her casts a long strip across the empty Market Square.
Mist swells in the small pools of light from streets ligh The rest is swathed in dark shadows. The hat is clear acr the square.
Steeling herself, Winnie creeps out and down the stairs, fancy satin slippers are silent. She gets to the bottom o the stairs and looks around. Nobody there.
The white hat looms from a distance.   She gasps, realizi how far she has to go.
She creeps forward a few more steps and hears a noise. Sh hears something skittering along out in the fog and makes terrified SQUEAK. She covers her mouth.
Something is watching her.
Who... who's there?
A shape steps forward from the darkness of a nearby alley but is obscured by mist. Two little lights cut through th vapor.
Winnie scrunches her face slightly, focusing intently on figure.
The shape creeps a little closer. A hunched-over silhouet with glowing round eyes. It's a boxtroll monster!
Winnie gasps. She stays put and turns her head to the sid screwing up her face with curiosity as the figure stands upright.
The figure takes another step towards her. REVEAL it is E He lifts his goggles. The light from the street lamp reve his face. He is guarded but curious and mimics Winnie's expression.
She gasps in wonder, the hat momentarily forgotten.
Who are you, boy?
Eggs looks confused.
Boy?
Fish and Shoe suddenly grab him from behind and pull him of Market Square.
(to Fish and Shoe) Why would she call me that?
Suddenly, BRIGHT LIGHTS hit them! It's the REDHATS' TRUCK
Eggs and the boxtrolls sprint around the square, chased b the Redhats.
They're right there, Mr. Trout!
WITH WINNIE as she watches Eggs and the boxtrolls sprint of the square just a few steps a head of the Redhat's tru
We're right behind you. HA hahaha!
Winnie stares, slack-jawed as the truck's lights disappea down the hill, then she turns and reaches for her father' hat, but it's gone, instead she sees--
-- a big shadowy figure holding the hat and staring at it lustily -- Archibald Snatcher. Winnie GASPS.
Hmm. Someone's out past curfew. Very dangerous.
Winnie is speechless for a moment, then-
I... I saw a boy.
Snatcher still stares at the hat.
All I saw was filthy boxtroll monsters.
Snatcher finally looks at Winnie with an oily, false smil
Miss Portley-Rind. Allow me to escort you home.
Snatcher leans down and offers his arm to Winnie. She snu him.
I can escort myself, thank you.
Winnie turns her back to Snatcher and he gives a grunt of frustration and restraint. She turns back to collect the hat.
If you'll just give me my father's hat back.
Winnie grabs for the hat. Snatcher swishes it out of her reach and heads for the stairs into the Guild.
Yes, how did this hat find itself aaaaall the way out here?
Winnie runs after him.
The... wind! Blew it, right out the window. Very windy tonight!
Snatcher looks doubtful. He licks his finger and holds it
Hmmm. Must've died down. Suddenly!
Snatcher heads right to the front door.
There's no need to go inside.
Oh, but as a gentleman, I insist.
Snatcher shoves open the doors, pushes his way into the f
-- and approaches the foot of the main stairs.
Lord Portley-Rind!
CLOSE ON the TASTING ROOM DOORS.
SFX Muffled voices of White Hats enjoying themselves sudd stop.
Did you hear something?
Winnie winces. She turns to Snatcher who is admiring the white hat again.
Can I have the hat back now?
Snatcher puts the hat behind his back, grins and pulls Wi up the stairs by her wrist, toward the Tasting Room.
Please.
Portley-Rind bursts out to see Snatcher ascending the sta
What in Gouda's name is going on? Archibald Snatcher?
Deepest apologies, your Lordship. But I found something out in the street that belongs to you.
Snatcher gestures behind him revealing a sheepish Winnie. he turns he also reveals the white hat. Portley-Rind rush down the stairs to meet Snatcher half way and GRABS THE H
My White Hat!
Winnie looks stricken.
Huh?
As Portley-Rind pulls on the hat, Snatcher refuses to let go, so they tug each other up and down the stairs.
I'll take that... Now, now, Snatcher one doesn't acquire a white hat by simply--
--picking it up... off the street.
Portley-Rind finally wins the tussle and grabs the hat ba He growls under his breath at the smudges left on the bri
A white hat indicates privilege, prestige, position!
It must be earned.
He removes a handkerchief from his breast pocket and dabs the hat's brim.
From the top of the stairs the other Guild members chime
With Valor!
Chivalry!
Or being rich! That's how I got it.
Snatcher looks up at them and bows, removing his red hat.
Oh, don't I know it, sirs.
Snatcher climbs the stairs and gets face to face with Por Rind.
Fortunately, we still have our little... agreeeeement.
Portley-Rind grimaces, remembering.
Um.. ehhh...
Snatcher opens his arms, gesturing widely, as he recites particulars of the deal.
When I destroy every last boxtroll in this town, I shall earn my white hat... and join you in the Tasting Room.
Snatcher takes a step toward the Tasting Room door and lo longingly into its warm, inviting interior. The White Hat reach back and slam the doors shut. Snatcher's face falls
Good lord. (twists his mustache) Not sure who should be more terrified - the boxtrolls or us.
The White Hats chuckle. Snatcher's expression drops into scowl. Portley-Rind puts his hat back on.
Now, how the devil did my hat get outside in the first place?
Snatcher smirks and gestures toward Winnie.
I was told the wind had something to do with it.
The wind, eh?
Portley-Rind looks at Winnie and frowns.
Father, I'm sorry--
Sorry! Can't stay. Too much work to do.
Miss Portley-Rind, your Lordship, Sirs. I bid you good night. I'm sure we'll be seeing each other again very, very soon.
Snatcher oozes out the door. Portley-Rind looks at Winnie shakes his head.
Hmmmm.. Winnie...
Winnie is about to defend herself when Snatcher pops his back in and points to his head.
Don't forget. I'm a size six-and-a- half. Order ahead.
As he finally leaves, his hat gets caught in the door and lets out a frustrated growl/groan.
Ugh!
Winnie pleads her case from the foot of the stair case as White Hats return to their cheese.
Father, I'm sorry! I didn't mean to. Well, at first I did, but I think this situation offers a great opportunity for a father and daughter to discuss their feelings--
Portley-Rind rolls his eyes and turns back to the Tasting Room.
--WAIT! I saw something out there. A boy with boxtrolls--
Not another word.
But Father I really-
Bed!
Portley-Rind shuts the door leaving Winnie alone. She loo back towards the front doors.
I did see a boy...
CLOSE ON: Fish, Eggs and Shoe sprinting down a twisting a turning street. The Redhats' vehicle is right behind them
Eggs' helmet is blown off while he runs. It flies onto th street behind them and is crushed under the Redhats' truc
Hark! Here come The Exterminators!
Exterminate! HA ha ha ha!
But don't that sound like we're the villains?
Huh.

head_text.subj: ON TWO BOXTROLLS, SPARKY AND SNIPS, GATHERING A FEW BLOCK

text: AHEAD: BAM! They are hit by headlights as Fish, Eggs and come running between them.
RUN!
Sparky and Snips hide in their boxes.
Hark! Here come The Exterminators... OF JUSTICE!
WE EXTERMINATE JUSTICE!
Mr. Pickles and Mr. Trout look at each, both terrified of Gristle.
Faster!
Grab hold!

Eggs, Fish and Shoe join hands and leap from the streets rooftops. As they careen from roof to roof, the boxtrolls tuck into their boxes, but Eggs can't fit in his box. He wraps his arms around Fish's box and rides on Shoe's box.
The Redhats' vehicle skids around the bend and swerves through the streets until it gets below them. Gristle's h sticks out, wind whipping his face like a dog.
HA HA HA!
Over there Mr. Trout!
Pickles nervously aims a BOLAS GUN, clearly not comfortab with the weapon. He fires, and a WEIGHTED BOLAS shoots ou but, misses Eggs and the boxtrolls badly.
Eggs, Fish, and Shoe tumble off of the rooftops. They fal through the air before bouncing from a store AWNING and landing on the cobblestone street.
Eggs leads the boxtrolls toward a drain pipe.
This way!
Gristle FIRES his sawed off BOLAS GUN as the truck skids!
My turn! HA HA!
The bolas whizzes toward Eggs and the fleeing boxtrolls a they leap into a drain pipe!
ON FISH as a the weighted bolas wrap around his box. His feet are pulled out from under him as he reaches out towa his friends.
Egg!
The bolas rope is attached to the Redhats truck, just out of the sewer pipe. The rope tightens as they begin to win up the slack.

Eggs and Shoe turn to see Fish grabbing the sides of the slick sewer, trying not to be pulled away. Eggs scrambles around Shoe, hiding in his box, and rushes to Fish as he dragged down the pipe towards the Redhats.
Eggs grabs Fish's hand, but the Redhats are too strong. F frantically cries out.
Eggs! Eggs!
No!
Eggs can't hold on and Fish's hand slips free, he's pulle out of the pipe CRYING!
EGGGGS!
Fish is yanked out of sight.   Eggs is left lying on the ground, gasping ffor breath.   His best friend is gone.
Eggs startles as Shoe touches his shoulder. He looks up a Shoe shakes his head, resigned. Shoe takes Eggs' arm and slowly leads him deeper into the pipe bend, toward home.
CLOSE ON the spinning Quattro Sabatinos record.
Eggs sits hunched over in despair with one finger resting the music machine, causing it to play very, very, slowly.
Behind Eggs we see Shoe's face appear. He stares at Eggs.
Shoe throws a bug at Eggs. It bounces off his head. No reaction, so Shoe does it again... still no reaction.
Shoe enters the nook. Eggs looks at him. Shoe holds out t hands full of yummy bugs.
(gurgles) Bugs for dinner?
Nothing.
Shoe sighs, and puts a bug in his mouth.
Why do we do this, Shoe...
Shoe stops eating, opens his mouth as if to answer then pauses, agape. The bug crawls out and up onto the top of head. Shoe thinks, gurgling.
Carry on like everything is normal? They drag us away and we do nothing...
The lucky bug extends it's wings and flies away. Shoe doe react. He doesn't know what to say.
Shoe glances out of the cave as the remaining boxtrolls s to make what's left of the communal sleeping pile.

Shoe looks back and forth between Eggs and the sleeping p He knows he should stay, but the sleeping pile is really coming together out there. With a whine of frustration fo his friend, he shakes off some bugs for Eggs to eat and leaves.
Eggs sighs and looks over to the corner where Fish's old and bow lean against the wall.
The bugs Shoe left crawl up Eggs' arm and he angrily shov them away and notices the Quattro Sabatino's RECORD COVER

CLOSE ON: The faces of the four singers, each one festoon with an elaborate mustache, and then on to their orange a brown striped coats and finally focussing on their straw boater hats. Eggs lowers it to reveal--

--Eggs REFLECTION IN AN OLD CRACKED MIRROR. He is wearing disguise based on the singers from the Quattro Sabatino's record cover (which he holds in his hand). He has made a striped jacket by sewing strips of orange fabric to an ol coat and found a filthy old straw boater. He has even dra twirled Van Dyck mustache on his face with a lump of coal
I look like one of them.
(SIGH) Sort of.
He looks at the pile of sleeping boxtrolls as they snore. looks back at the mirror.
I'll find you, Fish!
He tiptoes out into the cavern and sneaks off into the shadows.
In a pitch black sewer, a thin ray of sunlight shoots dow from a hole in a manhole cover.
Eggs' filthy hand, wrapped in torn strips of fabric, reac into the light. Dust motes drift around his hand and glow The reflected light illuminates Eggs' wide eyed face.
DOWN SHOT: Eggs climbs up toward the manhole. He has to squint at the bright sunlight.
EGGS POV: Looking up at the manhole until the bright ligh fills the screen.
SFX: As we go into the light, the sound of the streets of bustling city gets louder and louder.
CLOSE ON: A heavy cast iron manhole as it grinds open. Blinding sunlight pours in.
Eggs' dirty face peeks out. His eyes go wide.
Wow...
KLANG! A fat man steps on the manhole cover and slams it shut.
Ahh!
A beat. The manhole opens again (KLANG!!), and again is slammed shut as it is driven over, by a CART that stops.

Eggs shoves the manhole open and clambers out. For a seco he's reassured at how calm it is then the cart moves off he is left crouching in the middle of a busy street. He l up and is BLINDED BY THE SUN. AAARGH!
DRUM BEATS and a CYMBAL CRASH! Eggs jumps out of the way ONE MAN BAND marches through, almost running him over. He pushed and shoved by a festive crowd...
AHHHH!!!
Outta the way!
Until he backs into an OLD TIMEY BACKDROP painted with lu images of monstrous boxtrolls stealing a wailing baby.
Get yer picture taken with the Trubshaw Baby! A humorous keepsake for this dark and dreadful day!
AHHHH!! (rights himself) Eek.
Eggs stumbles backwards into the crowd where he is crushe between pedestrians until he is lifted off the ground and carried along.
Ehh! Oof. Eek!
Above Eggs the bright sun distorts the faces in the crowd like in a fever dream.
Eggs is carried along, his feet lifted off of the ground the bustling crowd.
Hey. Oww!
The crowd parts and he is dropped to the ground at the fo of a stage with a loud OOF!
Everyone hushes as a too enthusiastic CARNIVAL BARKER'S v introduces the act.
Ladies and gents, From the long- lost land of Crackerslovakia -- MADAME FROU FROU!
MADAME FROU FROU bursts through the curtains. She's a big sexy, voluptuous woman, exotic in a weird Eastern Europea MAE WEST kind of way.
Helloooo Cheesebridge! Hello darlinks! Thank you! Thank you! My darlinks!
Yoo hoo! I'm your biggest fan, Frou Frou.
Portley-Rind and the White Hats call from their exclusive podium in the center of the crowd. Winnie and a very bore Lady Cynthia Portley-Rind stand next to Lord Portley-Rind
Lord Portley-Rind, you are TOO much.
Or maybe just enough! Rowrr!
Frou Frou gives him a wink as Lady Portley-Rind elbows hi the stomach.
Oof. Very good.
Frou Frou takes center stage.
Today I shall perform ze sad tale of ze Trubshaw baby! But first, I need a helper from ze audience!
Winnie jumps up and down, waving her hand enthusiasticall
(raises hand, jumps) Me! Pick me! Me!
(pretending not to see
Anyone? Anyone at all? Nobody?
Excuse me, I'd like to--
Winnie roughly elbows the boy out of the way--
Move aside! Pick me...
-- and climbs up on stage without being asked. Eggs is transfixed - It IS the girl from last night!
Ah! Little Miss Portley-Rind, you shall play ze sweet little baby Trubshaw.
Frou Frou gives Winnie a bonnet.
I saw a boy with boxtrolls last night! Maybe your audience would like to hear-- OOF!
Frou Frou shoves a pacifier in Winnie's mouth and scoots behind the curtains.
Stick to ze script, my darlink!
Frou Frou walks to the BARREL ORGAN and turns the BRASS HANDLE. Once it is wound, she takes her place at center stage, a FAN poised coyly over her face.
Ten years ago a plot was hatched Where evil was with cunning matched Whoever left their doors unlatched Would find their infant children
ON EGGS watching the show, shocked.
What?!
Back to the show.
Oo    no   Boxtrolls
Winnie and Mr. Pickles, without his red hat and wearing a fake mustache, come dancing out on stage as Papa Trubshaw Baby Trubshaw. Pickles struggles to pick up Winnie and ho her like a baby.
Trubshaw Senior loved his kid The same as regular father's did If you don't want to share his
Make sure that you are locked up
Winnie dances in place and pretends to sleep as Pickles w off stage.
For this night Baby's Dad Trubshaw Quite forgot to lock his door And as soon as he began to snore The Boxtrolls came in to withdraw
Those vile Boxtrolls
A trap door opens in the stage floor and Mr. Gristle clim out dressed in a crude BOXTROLL COSTUME made from papier- mГўchГ©. Gristle GROWLS.
So lock your windows, bolt your
Or Boxtrolls with their creepy
Will take your children in their
And drag them down to feed their
The crowd HISSES as Gristle grabs Winnie and pushes her d the trap! Gristle makes CHOMPING and NOM NOM sounds.
RAWR!
Pickles runs onto the stage melodramatically pantomiming heart-broken father searching for his missing child.
Mister Trubshaw went quite wild When he found out he'd lost his
He did what any Dad would do He ran off swiftly to pursue those
Mr. Gristle returns and stalks Pickles from behind--
No! / Behind you!/ Look out man! He's behind you!
--And, a bit too enthusiastically, shoves Pickles down through trap door.
"Help, help, help me please won't you?" But the Boxtrolls did what
They snatched him up and began to
Until there was no residue Of Trubshaw.
Mr. Trout throws an arm full of papier-mГўchГ© BONES onto stage. Gristle picks one up, shoves it into his papier-mГ jaws and taunts the audience like a villainous profession wrestler.
They pulled him down into their
Hardly pausing to digest They left his bones but ate the
Never be a dinner guest
Oo those Boxtrolls
Booooo!
But she's lying.
A man standing next to Eggs overhears and looks down at h Eggs pales and pulls his disguise tighter.
And that's the story of the
Don't do what Father Trubshaw did If you see Boxtrolls don't placate
Catch 'em and exterminate them
Frou Frou wallops Gristle with her fan. The crowd cheers on as she beats the crap out of him in a not-very-ladylik fashion. The crowd is whipped into a frenzy!
Kill those Boxtrolls!
Eggs is crushed by the furious crowd as they chant along Madame Frou Frou.
Kill those Boxtrolls!
Kill those boxtrolls!
Don't forget about our party tonight, Frou Frou!
Eggs looks around at the frantic crowd, he sees Winnie exiting out the back of the stage. She dusts herself off heads back into the crowded market. Eggs follows her.
As Winnie makes her way across the crowded square Eggs follows her.
- When he sees the One Man Band coming closer, he ducks d into a box shape as if he could hide like a real boxtroll When the danger is passed he looks up and sees Winnie disappearing into the crowd.
- Eggs runs to catch up and has to jump over a vendor pus a cart.
Hey? What the...
- Eggs falls in behind Winnie a she nonchalantly circles tent of a cheese seller. She suddenly looks back and STAR RIGHT AT EGGS! Eggs hides behind a Swiss cheese.
Winnie ignores him and heads off down the street with Egg still following until she--
--Lunges around a corner and disappears! Eggs runs after turns the corner and she's gone. Suddenly she jumps out i front of him.
What do you want!
Eggs, startled, instinctively hides in a barrel. Winnie p in at him.
You're the worst pickpocket I have ever seen.
She tosses him a coin.
Here, buy yourself a book on how to be a better thief.
She walks away shaking her head.
Eggs climbs up out of the barrel.
Wait! I saw you last night.
Winnie freezes, eyes wide. She slowly turns back to him. looks down, too scared to look her in the eye.
And they took Fish, and... I don't know where they took him...
He looks up and Winnie is right in front of him.
Ah!
You were with the boxtrolls last night?
Eggs wipes the coal dust mustache from his face.
Yes.
Whoah! I KNEW IT! I KNEW IT! I KNEW IT!
Winnie gleefully dances about as Eggs climbs out of the barrel.
Father didn't believe me but I KNEW IT! How did you escape?!
We went underground and they--
Did they drag you down to their hideous caves?
Huh?
Eggs backs up as Winnie advances, intensely presses him f information.
Were there mountains of baby bones and rivers of blood?
What?
Did they eat your family?
Did they let you watch?!
I mean, make you watch?!
She grabs him by the shoulders.
TELL ME EVERYTHING!
Freaked out and frustrated, Eggs BITES HER ON THE ARM. Sh freezes. They stare at each other, Eggs panting, her in shock. She looks down at her arm flabbergasted.
You bit me.
I need to find the Men in Red Hats!
Winnie looks at the bite mark again.
You bit me with your mouth.
The Men in Red Hats!
The boxtroll exterminators? They live down on Curd's Way.
How do I get there?
Winnie points to the Milk Street sign that they are stand under.
Curds Way? Milk turns into it.
The one man band drops a CYMBAL: BA DUM CHHHH!
Eggs turns to go, then hesitates.
It's not true, you know.
We don't eat babies!
He runs off down the street.
We? What do you mean we?
Eggs rounds a corner and is gone.
Come back here! TELL ME EVERYTHING!
She takes off after him.
CLOSE ON Fish's frightened face peeking out from under hi box lid. REVEAL he's in a cage, being stared at by the th Redhats -- Pickles, Trout and Gristle.
Gristle reaches up and pokes him with a cricket bat.
POKE.
You ever wonder what they're thinkin' `bout, Mr. Trout?
I imagine they're evaluating their life choices.
Ah. Wonderin' why they chose to be evil, disgusting monsters instead of good guys like us!
Wrong, Mr. Pickles!
They turn to see Snatcher, coming down a long walkway beh them, backlit by tall windows. He finishes drying his fac with a towel, then walks towards them, orating THEATRICAL
A boxtroll cannot CHOOSE a new life because a boxtroll does not ASPIRE to be anything more than a weak, lowly pest.
But a man -- a great man! (tosses towel, arms wide) And his...
Colleagues?
Best chums?
... stooges
... can choose to change their lives. Our dreams are in our grasp!
Snatcher lifts Mr. Gristle into the air.
Let us be dream-graspers, fate- snatchers, destiny-takers! Let us grasp our dreams and shove them down everyone's throat! Am I not right?
THROAT!
YES!
Snatcher throws Gristle and Pickles catches him in his ar holding him like a small child. Gristle smiles maniacally
That's why your name is the boss, boss!
I'mnotastooge, am I?
Pickles releases Gristle as they follow Snatcher.
Now, gentlemen. What better way to dream than to walk in the shoes of those to whom we aspire? Mr. Pickles, fetch the--
Shoes?
Clogs?
(brandishing cricket bat) BAT!
Cheese.
Snatcher walks away as Trout and Pickles blanche. Their f go from rapt attention to apprehension. Gristle just keep his deranged grin.
Oh no.
Oh dear.
Nice! Heh heh heh heh heh...
Cheesebridge looms quietly overhead. The camera slowly pa

Eggs reaches an intersection and stops at the street sign MILK AVE and CURDS WAY. He looks around at the industrial wasteland. In the distance is one lone building with a bl red top hat painted on the huge wooden door.
Eggs heads toward it.
CLOSE ON Snatcher's grimy hands holding up a white hat ma out of paper.
Men, don your white hats.
Snatcher lowers the paper hat onto his head. Across the t from him the Redhats replace their red hats with paper wh hats. They all sit at a table set with cracked crockery a mismatched plates.
Are you sure about this, boss? You know what cheese can do to you...
(tucking a napkin into his
Unless you are referring to how cheese brings men of respect and power together in brotherhood, no, I do not know what...
"Cheese. Does. To. Me."
(GULPS) That's what I meant then.
Marvelous! Then let us begin.

Trout takes a little piece of cheese out of a package lab "EXTRA MILD CHEDDAR". He focuses and cuts off the tiniest little sliver and puts it on a plate, inspects it and sli it into an even smaller piece... then slices it again... again... and again... and--
ENOUGH!

Snatcher bangs his fist on the table. Startled, Pickles a Trout jump. Then Trout puts a tiny slice of cheese on a p and very slowly rotates the top of the table like a Lazy Susan. It takes forever for Snatcher's plate to arrive in front of him.

Snatcher loses patience and spins the table so that a pla lands in front of him. As he moves to pierce the cheese w his fork, the plate shifts to the left. He glares at Mr. Trout and Mr. Pickles, who turned the table top. They immediately return the plate.
The Redhats stare nervously as Snatcher stabs the curd an raises it to his lips and places it on his tongue. He che relishing it, then swallows.
Mmmm!
The Redhats relax. They take a tiny piece of cheese each eat it.
I say, old chaps, it's quite, um...
--Aromatic? Oaky? With an undertone of a mother's smile on a warm spring day? Hmm...
Yes! Those things! Etcetera etcetera, big words, chummy banter...
As the Redhats look on in horror, red spots appear across Snatcher's face. He scratches at them absently.
(whispered to Trout) Someone's got the cheese fits again.
Ohhh... (whispered to Gristle) Quickly, quietly, get the leeches.
Gristle scurries away, crossing behind Snatcher.
QUIETLY!
Where is he going? Is he getting more cheese?
Snatcher's lips instantly PUFF UP into huge, wobbly, distended FISH LIPS. The Redhats stare--
Quietly!
What?
I think you've had enough for today, boss.
In the background, Eggs' silhouette appears in the soot- covered window. He wipes away the grime to look in.
Eggs looks away from the window up at a large, rickety AI DUCT attached to the side of the building. He climbs into duct, leaving his disguise behind.
BACK TO SCENE. Snatcher's face is now grotesquely misshap and one eye has swollen shut like Quasimodo.
(slurred by swollen lips) Isn't this nice? Chewing the cheddar with the big cheessses. Holding my own--
--With sssophissstication and sssavoir faire!
Pickles, and Trout sit nervously at the table and stare a him.
Yup. Nothing terrifying about that.
(rubs his neck, nervously) Uh huh huh...
Thisss is where I belong!
He leans back in his "throne" and begins orating again.
Spot on, as always, sir.
Eggs appears peeking out of the air duct high on the fact wall.
You're not wrong, boss.
Well not here! In this rotten factory!
Snatcher quickly leans forward, slams his fist on the tab and stands.
I belong up there!
Eggs shrinks back into the duct, afraid that Snatcher has noticed him.
I'm agreeing so I don't upset you.
Very clever.
ON SNATCHER as he lurches up from the table and points to the city. Eggs retreats slightly into the duct in respons Snatcher's erratic movements.
In the tasting room, supping on the choicest cheeses... Everyone in town bowing down to me, like a gentleman, a lord with a white hat!
ON EGGS: He spots Fish in a cage suspended above the floo
Fish!
He   leaps onto a hanging chain and climbs.
